item.title: Report X-2024072461
item.description:
Report X-2024072461

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: WOODWARD
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 109565
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: 1. X-2024072461 :CTCX 725083 was involved in a derailment in Woodward, Ok. CTCX 725083 sustained a puncture to the B end top of the tank car. The puncture caused CTCX 725083 to release product. 2.X-2024072462: CTCX 725236 was involved in a mainline derailment on 7/11/2024. CTCX 725236 tank shell was punctured on the B end left side of the car. The puncture sustained to CTCX 725236 caused product to release.

item.title: Report E-2024080234
item.description:
Report E-2024080234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 28, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1903 was damaged by the driver and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and gravel beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1903-impacted gravel and trailer, and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.
